report: Clinical History 62 year old female with a history of Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma, currently undergoing evaluation for possible relapse. Diagnosis Bone marrow, right posterior iliac crest, aspirate smears, clot section, core biopsy and touch imprint 1. Bone marrow involved by recurrent Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma; see comment. 2. These cells are CD20 , PAX5 , CD10 , BCL6 , MUM1 , and exhibit a high proliferation rate Ki 67 80 . Flow cytometry confirms the presence of a clonal B cell population with similar immunophenotypic features. Cytogenetic and FISH studies are pending and may provide additional prognostic information. Megakaryocytes are present but reduced in number.
